intro: Hieracium nigrescens subsp. atroadenioides, commonly known as the Atroadeño hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. This subspecies is notable for its distinctive dark purple stems and its role in local ecosystems.
